Helpers Package

Submodules

plugins.helpers.data_quality_checker module

Defines the DataQualityChecker class to apply custom validators for each table column according to the rules specified by the JSON file.

class data_quality_checker.DataQualityChecker(rules, log)

This class defines the data quality check process to iterate over all table columns and apply the validation rules. You must extend the class and implement its abstract methods according to the target database.

check()

Iterate over all tables to apply column validation rules.

Returns

A JSON string reporting all table columns checks results.

abstract get_table_row_count(table)

Abstract method to get the total rows of a table. Must be implemented by the child class.

Parameters

table – The name of the table.

Returns

The number of rows of a table.

abstract get_valid_row_count(table, column, rules)

Abstract method to get the total rows of a table that comply with the validation rules for given a column. Must be implemented by the child class.

Parameters

  • table – The name of the table.

  • column – The column name to check the rules.

  • rules – An array of rules to validate the column.

Returns

The number of valid table rows for the given column.

plugins.helpers.redshift_checker module

Defines the RedshiftChecker class to implement the abstract validation methods inherited from DataQualityChecker.

class redshift_checker.RedshiftChecker(rules, log, redshift_connection_id='redshift')

This class defines the data quality check methods that implement each validation rule as an SQL statement compatible with Redshift.

get_table_row_count(table)

Gets the total number of rows of a table.

Parameters

table – The name of the table.

Returns

The number of rows of a table.

get_valid_row_count(table, column, rules)

Gets the sum of valid rows that match each rule defined for a table’s column.

Parameters

  • table – The name of the table.

  • column – The name of the column.

  • rules – An array of rule objects.

Returns

The sum of valid rows that match each rule.

plugins.helpers.sql_queries module

Defines the SqlQueries class where each property is set to a SQL statement to create tables, copy data from S3 files, and insert data from stage tables.

Module contents
